title: Readout of Principal Deputy National Security Advisor Jon Finer’s Call with UN Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees on the Humanitarian Situation in Gaza | The White House
content: Today, Principal Deputy National Security Advisor Jon Finer spoke with UN Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East (UNRWA) Commissioner General Philippe Lazzarini to discuss the dire humanitarian situation in Gaza. Finer expressed his condolences for the loss of 103 UNRWA staff since October 7, the highest number of UN aid workers killed in any conflict. He also expressed gratitude for the commitment of UNRWA’s staff to deliver humanitarian aid and provide essential services in Gaza.  The two discussed the critical importance of protecting civilians, including UN staff and other aid workers, and continuing to mitigate any potential aid diversion to Hamas. The United States remains committed to supporting the Agency’s critical work as a lifeline for millions.  Finer underscored the importance of the agency’s work to enable life-saving humanitarian aid to reach those in need in Gaza.###
